channel.title: Julias Design Apprenticeship Blog
channel.description: This blog contains Julia Murrays learnings during her Design Apprenticeship at 8th Light.

item.title: Post 2.2
item.description:
Web Accessibility


What is Web Accessibility

Web accessibility is the practice of building (design and developing) websites and other digital products so that users of all abilities can access them. The Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) provides a standard on how to do this and provides a success criteria of A, AA, and AAA. A success criteria is essentially a measure for the level of complaiance a website or application holds itself to.


Inaccessible websites create barriers for users who are/have:

  • Blind or low vision
  • Deaf or Hearing Impaired
  • Cognitative disabilities
  • Limited motor skills

Why Should We Care?

Often times companies brush of accessibility as unnecessary. Remarks such as "Those arent our users" and "We've always done it this way" are common rationals for keeping up with the status quo. In a perfect world we should all genuinely care about all users, including those with disabilities. Fortunately, there are several benefits to accessibility besides that fuzzy feeling you get when you're a decent human being.

To put it simply: accessibilty means good business. For example, if a site uses proper things like image alt attributes, title and header tags and html semantic markup, it returns better SEO results. Another factor is that most people at some point in their lives experience become disabled, even temporarily. Often times, most people will have difficulty viewing screens after lasik eye surgery. Broswer features like high contrast mode allow users to view screens with less strain on their eyes. Lastly, designing for accessibility safeguards your client against legal ramifications for non-complaince. If your client works in areas of the government, healthcare or airlines they are are most likely legally bound to adhere to WCAG. Even if they are outside these industries, they are still vulnerable to lawsuits. Among others in 2018, giants like Amazon and Nike have come under attack for non-compliance.


Start by Starting

Creating and implementing accessible digital products has 3 contributing parties: design (UX/visual), development and business. If you and/or your company is new to web accessibility, it can seem pretty intimidating to start. As a designer, your advantage is that you have influence from the very begining on implementing accessibity into your digital product. Up next well go through some very easy steps in order to start designing for accessibility and its benefits.

Make sure your colors meet contrast ratios

Stark sketch plugin Tanaguru contrast checker

Donâ€™t use color alone to communicate

Stark sketch plugin

Design focus states for all ui components and allow for keyboard navigation

focus states

Don't confuse placeholder text for form labels

Googles material design forms

Use alt text for non-text components

Microsoft voice-over all text

Use semantic markup for headings in your HTML

type scale"

item.title: Post 2.1
item.description:
CSS Positioning


The position property specifies the type of positioning method used for an element. The position types are static relative fixed absolute and sticky.

Static

HTML elements are positioned static by default. Static positioned elements are not affected by the top bottom left and right properties. An element with position: static is not positioned in any special way; it is always positioned according to the normal flow of the page:

.block1
{
padding: 15px;
background-color: red;
height: 90px;
position: static;
}
static

Relative

An element with position: relative; is positioned relative to its normal position. Setting the top right bottom and left properties of a relatively-positioned element will cause it to be adjusted away from its normal position. Other content will not be adjusted to fit into any gap left by the element.

.block1
{
padding: 15px;
background-color: red;
height: 90px;
position: relative;
left: 30px;
}
relative

Fixed

An element with position: fixed; is positioned relative to the viewport, which means it always stays in the same place even if the page is scrolled. The top, right, bottom, and left properties are used to position the element. A fixed element does not leave a gap in the page where it would normally have been located.

.block1
{
padding: 15px;
background-color: red;
height: 90px;
position: fixed;
bottom: 0;
right: 0;
}
fixed

Sticky

An element with position: sticky; is positioned based on the user's scroll position. A sticky element toggles between relative and fixed, depending on the scroll position. It is positioned relative until a given offset position is met in the viewport - then it "sticks" in place (like position:fixed).

.box1
{
width: 100px;
height: 100px;
position: sticky;
top: 0;
border: 2px solid #4CAF50;
}
sticky

Absolute

An element with position: absolute; is positioned relative to the nearest positioned ancestor (instead of positioned relative to the viewport, like fixed). However; if an absolute positioned element has no positioned ancestors, it uses the document body, and moves along with page scrolling.

.block1
{
padding: 15px;
background-color: red;
height: 90px;
position: relative;
}
 .block2
{
padding: 15px;
background-color: white;
height: 90px;
position: absolute;
top: 80px;
right: 0;
}
relative
absolute

Z Index

When elements are positioned, they can overlap other elements. The z-index property specifies the stack order of an element (which element should be placed in front of, or behind, the others). An element can have a positive or negative stack order.

.block1
{
padding: 15px;
background-color: pink;
height: 90px;
position: absolute;
left: 50px;
top: 2300px;
z-index: 1;
}
z-index

item.title: Post 1.2
item.description:
css positioning

Metadata Content

base Determines the base url for all links. When a link goes off to an external site this element has to appear before it.
link Used to connect a document to an external resource such as external stylesheets.
meta Specifies all the metadata within the html document, like author, description or keywords. This information is not visible on the page.
noscript If there are disabled scripts or issues with browser support noscript allows for alternate content. It can be used in the body and the head. If in the head elements are limited to link style and meta.
script Where scripts instructions are kept or link to external ones. Used to dynamically create block and/or inline content
style Defines style info in the document and specifies how different elements should be styled.
title title of a document, specified in the head section in an html document. The content entered here appears in the browser toolbar, creates a title when the page is added to favorites and displays a title in search engine results.

Flow Content

a Defines something as a hyperlink; an interactive element that will take the user to another page.
abbr Defines something as an abbreviation or an acronym
address Contact info for the owner of a document
article Defines an article in the document which could be a blog post, news story, comment, etc.
aside Defines content aside from main content. Aside content should still be related to the main content.
audio Defines audio content in the document. It accepts .mp3, .wav and .ogg
b Styles text within the html to be bold.
bdi Stands for bidirectional isolation. This is to take specific text and change the directionality from the direction of the text around it.
bdo Overrides the text direction of the entire document.
blockquote Will define content quoted from another source, and is usually indented.
br Creates a break in a line of text. Itâ€™s an empty tag, so there is no closing tag.
button Defines a clickable button. This can contain text or an image.
canvas Is used as a container to draw graphics via a script in javascript. This is just a container, the ability to draw is in the javascript.
cite Defines the title of work in art, literature, film, theater, etc.
code Defines a piece of computer code.
data> This allows content to be translated to a machine readable value and also provides for a browser rendering that can be consumed by users.
datalist Provides a list of predefined for an input element. This allows for autocomplete via a dropdown.
del Text that has been deleted from a document.
details Allows user to show/hide details about something. The default of details should be hidden unless the attribute is set to open.
dfm Defines an instance of a term and is usually the first time the term is used in the document.
div Creates a division within the html. Divs are used in css to style html or to do certain things in javascript.
dl Description list, is used with dd and dt.
dt Term/name description in a description list. Used with dd and dl.
em Emphasized text.
embed container for an external application or a plugin.
fieldset used to group information within a form and creates a box around it.
figure Specifies self contained content like an illustration, diagram, photos, etc.
footer Footer of a document, has information itâ€™s containing content like author, related links, site map, contact info, etc.
form creates an html form that the user can interact with and enter an input. input textarea button select option optgroup fieldset label can all be contained in a form. h1 to h6 Define html headings. H1 has the most importance, H6 has the least importance.
header Has introductory content and/or navigation. It can contain h1 to h6, logo or authorship info.
hr defines a thematic break in content and is often used to visually separate content.
i Identifies a shift in mood or tone within a set of text. Indicates a technical term, ship name, thought in a foreign language, etc. This should be rarely used, other options are em strong mark cite dfn
iframe defines an inline frame and embeds another document within the html.
img Defines an image within the document. Has 2 required attributes, src and alt. img holds a space for the image. The actual image is linked to the document within a tag.
input Used within the form element, this allows user to input data into the form.
ins Defines text that has been inserted into a document.
kpd defines a keyboard input and is a phrase tag. Can be achieved with CSS.
label Defines a label for an input field.
main Specifies the main content of a document. There can only be one main element per document.
map Creates an image map, which is an image with clickable areas. Contains multiple area elements.
mark Will define a section of text you want to mark and highlights it.
math The top element in MathML, a mathematical markup language, used as an XML application. meter Defines a scaled measurement like a gauge or fractional value. Examples are disk usage, query result, etc.
nav defines a set of navigation links.
noscript If there are disabled scripts or issues with browser support noscript allows for alternate content. It can be used in the body and the head. If in the head elements are limited to link style and meta.
object Identifies embedded objects in the document such as audio, video, javascript, pdf, other web pages, etc.
ol specifies an ordered list and can be either numeric or alphabetical. Used with li
optgroup used to create groups of data in a dropdown list, each group with its own label.
output Shows the result of a calculation that is run by a script.
p Paragraph
pre Preformatted text that preserved line breaks and spaces within the html.
progress Shows the progress as a task.
q Short quotation.
ruby specifies a ruby annotation. Itâ€™s attached to the main text to indicate the pronunciation or meaning on the text. Used with east asian typography.
s Indicates content is not longer accurate.
samp Defines sample output from computer program.
script Where scripts instructions are kept or link to external ones. Used to dynamically create block and/or inline content
section defines sections of a document like chapters headers or footers.
select creates a drop down list. Used with option
small Defines smaller text or side comments.
span Used to ground inline elements in a document.
strong is a phrase tag that emphasizes important text.
sub Allows for subscript text which appears half a character below the baseline of text.
sup Allows for subscript text which appears half a character above the baseline of text.
svg container for svg graphics which has many ways of drawing shapes, lines and images.
table Creates an HTML table that contains tr th and td and can also be as complex to include template Allows content to be hidden from the user, and it wonâ€™t be rendered in the browser.
textarea creates a multiline input control and can hold an unlimited number of characters.
time human readable date or time. Can also encode dates/times in a machine readable way.
ul defines an unordered, bulleted list. Each list item is defined by li
var phrase tage used to define a variable.
video defines a video like a movie clip or video streaming. Files supported are .mp4, .ogg, .webm wbr A position within text where the browser may optionally break a line, but not always at the location the element is in.

Sectioning Content

article Defines an article in the document which could be a blog post, news story, comment, etc.
aside Defines content aside from main content. Aside content should still be related to the main content.
footer Footer of a document, has information itâ€™s containing content like author, related links, site map, contact info, etc.
header Has introductory content and/or navigation. It can contain h1 to h6, logo or authorship info.
nav defines a set of navigation links.
section defines sections of a document like chapters headers or footers.

Heading Content

h1 h2 h3 h4 h5 h6 Six levels of section headings. h1 is the highest section level and h6 is the lowest..

Phrasing Content

abbr Defines something as an abbreviation or an acronym
audio Defines audio content in the document. It accepts .mp3, .wav and .ogg
b Styles text within the html to be bold.
bdo overrides the text direction of the entire document.
br Creates a break in a line of text. Itâ€™s an empty tag, so there is no closing tag.
button defines a clickable button. This can contain text or an image.
canvas is used as a container to draw graphics via a script in javascript. This is just a container, the ability to draw is in the javascript.
cite Defines the title of work in art, literature, film, theater, etc.
code defines a piece of computer code.
data> This allows content to be translated to a machine readable value and also provides for a browser rendering that can be consumed by users.
datalist provides a list of predefined for an input element. This allows for autocomplete via a dropdown.
dfn Defines an instance of a term and is usually the first time the term is used in the document.
em emphasized text.
embed container for an external application or a plugin.
i Identifies a shift in mood or tone within a set of text. Indicates a technical term, ship name, thought in a foreign language, etc. This should be rarely used, other options are em strong mark cite dfn
iframe defines an inline frame and embeds another document within the html.
img Defines an image within the document. Has 2 required attributes, src and alt. img holds a space for the image. The actual image is linked to the document within a tag.
input Used within the form element, this allows user to input data into the form.
kbd defines a keyboard input and is a phrase tag. Can be achieved with CSS.
label Defines a label for an input field.
mark Will define a section of text you want to mark and highlights it.
meter Defines a scaled measurement like a gauge or fractional value. Examples are disk usage, query result, etc.
math The top element in MathML, a mathematical markup language, used as an XML application. noscript If there are disabled scripts or issues with browser support noscript allows for alternate content. It can be used in the body and the head. If in the head elements are limited to link style and meta.
object Identifies embedded objects in the document such as audio, video, javascript, pdf, other web pages, etc.
output Shows the result of a calculation that is run by a script.
progress Shows the progress as a task.
q Short quotation.
small Defines smaller text or side comments.
span Used to ground inline elements in a document.
strong is a phrase tag that emphasizes important text.
sub Allows for subscript text which appears half a character below the baseline of text.
sup Allows for subscript text which appears half a character above the baseline of text.
svg container for svg graphics which has many ways of drawing shapes, lines and images.
textarea c reates a multiline input control and can hold an unlimited number of characters.
time human readable date or time. Can also encode dates/times in a machine readable way.
var phrase tage used to define a variable.
video defines a video like a movie clip or video streaming. Files supported are .mp4, .ogg, .webm wbr A position within text where the browser may optionally break a line, but not always at the location the element is in.

Embedded Content

audio Defines audio content in the document. It accepts .mp3, .wav and .ogg
canvas is used as a container to draw graphics via a script in javascript. This is just a container, the ability to draw is in the javascript.
embed container for an external application or a plugin.
iframe defines an inline frame and embeds another document within the html.
img Defines an image within the document. Has 2 required attributes, src and alt. img holds a space for the image. The actual image is linked to the document within a tag.
math The top element in MathML, a mathematical markup language, used as an XML application. object Identifies embedded objects in the document such as audio, video, javascript, pdf, other web pages, etc.
svg container for svg graphics which has many ways of drawing shapes, lines and images.
video defines a video like a movie clip or video streaming. Files supported are .mp4, .ogg, .webm

Interactive Content

a Defines something as a hyperlink; an interactive element that will take the user to another page.
button defines a clickable button. This can contain text or an image.
details Allows user to show/hide details about something. The default of details should be hidden unless the attribute is set to open.
embed container for an external application or a plugin.
iframe defines an inline frame and embeds another document within the html.
label Defines a label for an input field.
select creates a drop down list. Used with option
textarea creates a multiline input control and can hold an unlimited number of characters.

Form Associated Content

Listed

button defines a clickable button. This can contain text or an image.
fieldset used to group information within a form and creates a box around it.
input Used within the form element, this allows user to input data into the form.
object Identifies embedded objects in the document such as audio, video, javascript, pdf, other web pages, etc.
output Shows the result of a calculation that is run by a script.
select creates a drop down list.
textarea creates a multiline input control and can hold an unlimited number of characters.

Lableable

button defines a clickable button. This can contain text or an image.
input Used within the form element, this allows user to input data into the form.
label Defines a label for an input field.
meter Defines a scaled measurement like a gauge or fractional value. Examples are disk usage, query result, etc.
output Shows the result of a calculation that is run by a script.
progress Shows the progress as a task.
select creates a drop down list.
textarea creates a multiline input control and can hold an unlimited number of characters.

Submitable

button defines a clickable button. This can contain text or an image.
output Shows the result of a calculation that is run by a script.
select creates a drop down list.
textarea creates a multiline input control and can hold an unlimited number of characters.

Resetable

input Used within the form element, this allows user to input data into the form.
output Shows the result of a calculation that is run by a script.
select creates a drop down list.
textarea creates a multiline input control and can hold an unlimited number of characters.
button defines a clickable button. This can contain text or an image.
fieldset used to group information within a form and creates a box around it.
form creates an html form that the user can interact with and enter an input. input textarea button select option optgroup fieldset label can all be contained in a form. h1 to h6 Define html headings. H1 has the most importance, H6 has the least importance.
input Used within the form element, this allows user to input data into the form.
label Defines a label for an input field.
meter Defines a scaled measurement like a gauge or fractional value. Examples are disk usage, query result, etc.
object Identifies embedded objects in the document such as audio, video, javascript, pdf, other web pages, etc.
output Shows the result of a calculation that is run by a script.
progress Shows the progress as a task.
select creates a drop down list. Used with option
textarea creates a multiline input control and can hold an unlimited number of characters.

All Elements

 !--...-- A way to make notes in the html without it affecting the actual document
!DOCTYPE Defines the doc type a Defines something as a hyperlink; an interactive element that will take the user to another page.
abbr Defines something as an abbreviation or an acronym
address Contact info for the owner of a document
area Defines area inside of an image map which has clickable area in it. Itâ€™s always contained within a map element.
article Defines an article in the document which could be a blog post, news story, comment, etc.
aside Defines content aside from main content. Aside content should still be related to the main content.
audio Defines audio content in the document. It accepts .mp3, .wav and .ogg
b Styles text within the html to be bold.
base Determines the base url for all links. When a link goes off to an external site this element has to appear before it.
bdi Stands for bidirectional isolation. This is to take specific text and change the directionality from the direction of the text around it.
bdo overrides the text direction of the entire document.
blockquote Will define content quoted from another source, and is usually indented.
body defines all the content within the html document. Everything in the body is visible to the user.
br Creates a break in a line of text. Itâ€™s an empty tag, so there is no closing tag.
button defines a clickable button. This can contain text or an image.
canvas is used as a container to draw graphics via a script in javascript. This is just a container, the ability to draw is in the javascript.
caption Lives within a table and allows one caption per table.
cite Defines the title of work in art, literature, film, theater, etc.
code defines a piece of computer code.
col Defines properties of a column within a colgroup.
colgroup defines formatting multiple columns within a table.
data>This allows content to be translated to a machine readable value and also provides for a browser rendering that can be consumed by users.
datalistprovides a list of predefined for an input element. This allows for autocomplete via a dropdown.
dd Allows for a term/name description list. It is used with dl and dt.
del Text that has been deleted from a document.
details Allows user to show/hide details about something. The default of details should be hidden unless the attribute is set to open.
dfm Defines an instance of a term and is usually the first time the term is used in the document.
dialog creates a dialog box, often used for pop ups or modals.
div creates a division within the html. Divs are used in css to style html or to do certain things in javascript.
dl Description list, is used with dd and dt.
dt term/name description in a description list. Used with dd and dl.
em emphasized text.
embed container for an external application or a plugin.
fieldset used to group information within a form and creates a box around it.
figcap Caption for a figure element. Can be the first or last child of the element.
figure Specifies self contained content like an illustration, diagram, photos, etc.
footer Footer of a document, has information itâ€™s containing content like author, related links, site map, contact info, etc.
form creates an html form that the user can interact with and enter an input. input textarea button select option optgroup fieldset label can all be contained in a form. h1 to h6 Define html headings. H1 has the most importance, H6 has the least importance.
head Where all the metadata and other processing info is kept. title style head Where all the metadata and other processing info is kept. title base link meta script noscript can all go in the head.
link meta script noscript can all go in the head.
header Has introductory content and/or navigation. It can contain h1 to h6, logo or authorship info.
hr defines a thematic break in content and is often used to visually separate content.
html identifies the document as html and communicates it to the browser. It contains all html elements except !DOCTYPE
i Identifies a shift in mood or tone within a set of text. Indicates a technical term, ship name, thought in a foreign language, etc. This should be rarely used, other options are em strong mark cite dfn
iframe defines an inline frame and embeds another document within the html.
img Defines an image within the document. Has 2 required attributes, src and alt. img holds a space for the image. The actual image is linked to the document within a tag.
input Used within the form element, this allows user to input data into the form.
ins Defines text that has been inserted into a document.
kpd defines a keyboard input and is a phrase tag. Can be achieved with CSS.
label Defines a label for an input field.
legend for a fieldset element.
li Creates a list item and is used with ul, ol and menu
link Used to connect a document to an external resource such as external stylesheets.
main Specifies the main content of a document. There can only be one main element per document.
map Creates an image map, which is an image with clickable areas. Contains multiple area elements.
mark Will define a section of text you want to mark and highlights it.
meta Specifies all the metadata within the html document, like author, description or keywords. This information is not visible on the page.
meter Defines a scaled measurement like a gauge or fractional value. Examples are disk usage, query result, etc.
nav defines a set of navigation links.
noscript If there are disabled scripts or issues with browser support noscript allows for alternate content. It can be used in the body and the head. If in the head elements are limited to link style and meta.
object Identifies embedded objects in the document such as audio, video, javascript, pdf, other web pages, etc.
ol specifies an ordered list and can be either numeric or alphabetical. Used with li
optgroup used to create groups of data in a dropdown list, each group with its own label.
option Defines objects in a select list/dropdown. Used with either select or datalist.
output Shows the result of a calculation that is run by a script.
p Paragraph
param defines parameters for plugins embedded with object.
picture Allows for multiple designed images to be used depending on the browser viewport. You can use or tags with it.
pre Preformatted text that preserved line breaks and spaces within the html.
progress Shows the progress as a task.
qShort quotation.
rp Creates parentheses around a ruby text, shown by browsers that donâ€™t support ruby annotations.
. rt gives a ruby annotation that defines an explanation/pronunciation for east asian typography. Used with ruby and rt.
ruby specifies a ruby annotation. Itâ€™s attached to the main text to indicate the pronunciation or meaning on the text. Used with east asian typography.
s Indicates content is not longer accurate.
samp Defines sample output from computer program.
script Where scripts instructions are kept or link to external ones. Used to dynamically create block and/or inline content
section defines sections of a document like chapters headers or footers.
select creates a drop down list. Used with option
small Defines smaller text or side comments.
source The source tag is used to indicate multiple media resources like video audio and picture
span Used to ground inline elements in a document.
strong is a phrase tag that emphasizes important text.
style defines style info in the document and specifies how different elements should be styled.
sub Allows for subscript text which appears half a character below the baseline of text.
summary creates a visible heading for the details element.
sup Allows for subscript text which appears half a character above the baseline of text.
svg container for svg graphics which has many ways of drawing shapes, lines and images.
table Creates an HTML table that contains tr th and td and can also be as complex to include tbody Body content in an html table.
td standard cell within an html table.
template Allows content to be hidden from the user, and it wonâ€™t be rendered in the browser.
textarea creates a multiline input control and can hold an unlimited number of characters.
tfoot groups footer content inside an html table.
th header cell in an html table.
thead groups header content inside an html table.
time human readable date or time. Can also encode dates/times in a machine readable way.
title title of a document, specified in the head section in an html document. The content entered here appears in the browser toolbar, creates a title when the page is added to favorites and displays a title in search engine results.
tr row in an html table.
track text tracks for media elements, is visible when the media is playing.
u Used for text that should be stylistically different. Usage should be avoided because its easily confused with a link.
ul defines an unordered, bulleted list. Each list item is defined by li
var phrase tage used to define a variable.
video defines a video like a movie clip or video streaming. Files supported are .mp4, .ogg, .webm

item.title: Post 1.1
item.description:
Apprenticeship Goals

This week I started my design apprenticeship at 8th Light. As I am at the beginning of my journey here, I have some thoughts about how I want to improve during my apprenticeship.

Where Iâ€™ve been

Iâ€™m a native Texan where I come from a traditional graphic design background. I received my undergrad there, and instantly realized I couldn't stand the subjectivity of branding and art direction. My last year there I was fortunate enough to get an introduction to UX by taking some usability and app design courses, which changed everything for me. Shortly after graduating I moved with my (now) wife up to Chicago, where I started working as a Product Designer at Threadless. There I got to work in a more generalist environment, doing research, ux, visual design and some front end on a platform called Artist Shops. I loved being able to have that focus on a single product and to have an impact on it through every step of our design process. Since then, Iâ€™ve been a contract UX Designer at some larger fortune 500 corporations, first at United Airlines and most recently at Blue Cross Blue Shield. The work that Iâ€™ve done in the past 2 years has given me valuable experience in conducting ux research, evidence based design, interaction design, accessibility and visual design.

Where I want to go

Iâ€™ve noticed a common frustration in my experience as a designer: bad code limits access between humans and quality user experiences. This is common thing most professionals in the software world can understand. That sense of hopelessness you get as a designer when after months of research, white boarding and prototyping gets de-scoped into something unrecognizable. On the other hand, developers often get handled a mock-up with zero documentation and functionality that doesnâ€™t exist within the current framework. I'm sure there are many reasons why this happens, but in the end, it's hard handoffs between design and development that makes users hate bad software.

Front End Development

My primary goal is to focus more on front end development, as I feel it is my weakest area. I'm competent in building a pretty basic html/css responsive site. I would like to strengthen my skills and knowledge regarding implementation of my code. I'm still very new to GitHub, and specifically would like to understand best practices about file structure, branches and repositories. Iâ€™d also like to get experience workings in component libraries. On the design side, I'm pretty obsessed with pattern libraries, and have even built one myself, but would love to understand the front end side of things as well. I've done extensive work on the design side of accessibility standards but I would like to strengthen my development skills in that area as well.

Design

In terms of UX and visual design, I'm experienced and confident in many subjects, but there are definitely areas to improve. In the past I've planned, conducted and synthesized user research into UX strategy, but I've never had the opportunity to sit down with stakeholders and define an mvp with feature prioritization. One of the things that won me over during my interview was learning about how designers have impact on a product starting with the first meeting with the client. In addition, I would like to strengthen my skills with content management and strategy. In my past job I did have the opportunity to work with a content strategist. As designers, we tend to box the "user experience" to just the interface on the screen and we often forget about the words that we use.

How I'm going to get there

I think the biggest challenge for me is training my brain to think in a different way. Coming from a design background where everything is done is a visual way. This week I began introducing myself to our blog framework which includes understanding the command line and working with ruby. By forcing myself to change my visual right sided brain to think in a more analytical and linear way, I'm making myself extremely uncomfortable, which I couldn't be happier about. Even though I'm putting myself in unfamiliar territory, the people here at 8th Light have been amazing in helping me to work through my blockers quickly and providing me with resources to grow as a professional.
